channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Granville Road NW6 5AR, 25th August
item.description:
Street Needs Sweeping as Litter is around. It’s a shame the estate Cleaners are Seen With a Trolley walking along Granville Road and they will see Litter and Rubbish on the Pavement and they DO NOT BOTHER to Pick it up with there Litter Pickers. What are they getting Paid for. Wheeling around a Trolley?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead branch hanging from tree about to fall, 25th August
item.description:
There is a branch hanging from a tree on the pavement outside number 43 and 45. It is dead/dying compared with the rest of the tree and hanging vertically as it seems to have mostly snapped from the main branch. I It looks like it will break off completely soon and may cause injury or damage to people or cars underneath. It is a large branch. Please remove as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 35 Craven road with Brook Mews N dangerous corner, 25th August
item.description:
The single yellow line should be shortened and a double yellow line extended on Craven road at the corner with Brook Mews North. There is at weekend and evenings a car parked on the corner that makes it difficult and dangerous to come out of the Mews. If the double yellow was extended all the way to the first parking spot it would prevent parking so close to the corner preventing poor visibility when driving out of the Mews.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Craven Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Truman’s Road neglected: overflowing rubbish, fly tipping, unsafe conditions persist., 25th August
item.description:
Truman’s Road and Salcombe Road are consistently overflowing with rubbish, broken glass and fly tipping. Despite repeated reports, nothing has changed. Infrequent cleaning allows waste to accumulate, attracting rodents and foxes and worsening the problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped on common at top of Bramblebury Rd, 25th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead, London

item.title: My street has not been swept for 5 weeks, 25th August
item.description:
I have complain lots of times. Are road never gets swept. Rude man told me once a month he does it. Not the case. 3 times a week. Someone needs to check his work? He leaves are street for months. Dog poo. Little weeds everywhere.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wetherell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
